children: Atrial flutter is a reentrant arrhythmia with atrial rates typically between 250 and 300/min.
typically shows a saw-tooth pattern on the inferior leads and a positive deflection in lead V
. The ventricular response is often regular, although it may be irregular and can be confused with
Classically, patients have 2:1 conduction resulting in a ventricular response close to 150/min. Atrial flutter may be seen interspersed with AF or may follow treatment of AF.
Catheter ablation is the definitive treatment for typical atrial flutter. Guidelines for anticoagulation for atrial flutter are similar to those for AF.
